column2: UTAH DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column8: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 2. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column8: Honk your horn.

column2: 3. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column8: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.

column2: 4. If you suddenly have no control of the steering wheel, you should:
column4: pump your brake pedal to build pressure.
column6: turn on your emergency flashers and pull off the road.
column8: react as you would with a blowout.
column10: ease your foot off the gas pedal. Turn on your emergency flashers and allow your vehicle to come to a slow stop.

column2: 5. If one of your tires blows out, you should:
column4: hold the steering wheel tightly, slowly take your foot off the gas pedal and steer smoothly where you want to go.
column8: apply your brakes gently and steer smoothly where you want to go.
column10: pump your brakes and steer where you want to go.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column8: No right turn

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: Do not pass trucks

column2: 8. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column8: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column10: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 9. When changing lanes, __________ to be sure no one is in the "blind spot".
column8: slow down gradually

column2: 10. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column8: You continue to yawn.

column2: 11. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column8: look for a train.

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column4: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column6: that you must not drive past this sign.
column8: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column10: the entrance to a construction site.

column2: 13. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column8: A school crossing

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 15. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column8: vehicles

column2: 16. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.
column8: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 17. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column8: yellow; black

column2: 18. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column8: at an intersection.

column2: 19. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the right side of the road.
column6: look toward the left side of the road.
column8: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column10: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.

column2: 20. This sign indicates:
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 21. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column6: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 22. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column6: vehicle operators tend to drive faster at night.
column8: the ratio of motorcyles to cars is much higher at night.
column10: speed limits do not apply at night.

column2: 23. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.
column8: following a motorcycle.

column2: 24. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 25. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Yield.
